brand.name: Rainbow Robotics
brand.description: Founded in 2011 by researchers from KAIST Humanoid Robot Research Center, Rainbow Robotics specializes in developing advanced humanoid robotic systems. Creator of the world's first commercialized humanoid robot platform HUBO2, with robots deployed at world-class institutions like MIT and Google.

robots.name: HUBO2
keyFeatures: World's first commercialized humanoid robot platform
Cable-driven adaptive five-finger hand system with independent finger movement
Full-size humanoid capable of walking, running, dancing, and object manipulation
Sign language capability with dexterous fingers
Dual on-board computer system with real-time control
Deployed at 20+ world-class research institutions (MIT, Google, CMU, etc.)
Aluminum endoskeleton with polycarbonate frame for lightweight construction

hardwareBuildQuality.payloadCapacity: Object manipulation with adaptive five-finger hands

softwareEcosystem.rosSupport: ROS interface development in progress, simple joint control available
softwareEcosystem.apiDocumentationQuality: Rainbow API with Xenomai real-time framework support

warranty.duration: Contact Rainbow Robotics for warranty details

supplierReliability.postSalesSupport: Technical support for research institutions, software updates
supplierReliability.trackRecord: Founded by KAIST researchers, delivered to 20+ institutions worldwide including MIT, Google, CMU

specifications.maxSpeed: Walking: 1.25 km/h (0.95s cycle, 32cm stride), Running capable

features: World's first commercialized humanoid robot platform
Cable-driven adaptive five-finger hand system
Fingers can close according to object shape for versatile grasping
Full-size humanoid that can walk, run, dance, and grasp objects
Straight-leg walking gait technology
Lightweight aluminum and polycarbonate construction
44 motor system for complex movements
2-hour continuous operation capability
Real-time control system with Windows XP and RTX
Dual on-board computer system
Used by world-class research institutes (MIT, Google, CMU, etc.)
Delivered to over 20 institutions worldwide
robots.description: HUBO2 is the world's first commercialized humanoid robot platform, featuring advanced straight-leg walking technology, adaptive five-finger hands, and lightweight construction. Developed by KAIST and manufactured by Rainbow Robotics, it's deployed at leading research institutions worldwide including MIT and Google for advanced robotics research.

robots.name: RB-Q
keyFeatures: AI-enabled quadrupedal robot for complex terrain navigation
Traverses uneven and challenging environments with ease
Equipped with cameras, LiDAR, and wireless connectivity
Autonomous mission capability with remote control options
Extendable platform supporting custom payloads and sensor integration
Designed for research, patrol, and search & rescue missions

softwareEcosystem.rosSupport: ROS support available through Rainbow Robotics SDK

warranty.duration: Contact Rainbow Robotics for warranty details

supplierReliability.postSalesSupport: Technical support for development and deployment
supplierReliability.trackRecord: Built on Rainbow Robotics' expertise in advanced robotics platforms

features: AI-enabled quadrupedal robot platform
Complex terrain navigation capabilities
Equipped with cameras, LiDAR, and wireless connectivity
Autonomous mission and remote control functionality
Custom payload and sensor integration support
Flexible SDK-based development environment
Applications in research, patrol, and search & rescue
Professional robotics platform for real-world deployment
robots.description: RB-Q is Rainbow Robotics' AI-enabled quadrupedal robot platform designed for traversing uneven and complex terrain. Built for research, patrol, and search & rescue missions, it features cameras, LiDAR, wireless connectivity, and supports custom payloads with flexible SDK-based development.
